body.p:
Mt Sterling Ky 14" Sep' 1864
To
His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette,
Frankfort. Ky
Sir

I beg to inform your Excellency that I believe I can raise a Company of men for Train and Railroad protection: or, any other duty subject to your Excellency's order -- but unattached to any Regiment -- if you will commission me to do so,
I beg most respectfully to refer your Excellency to the following Citizens of Lebanon Ky.
Messrs. L. A. Spaulding, Dick Ben Spaulding, Len Edlin, and William Brickin.

Most respectfully
Your Excellency's
Humble Servant
Paul. J. Rattigan

Mt Sterling - Montgomery
Ky State Guard
Mt. Sterling Ky
Septr 14th 1864
Rattigan Paul J.
To the Gov. and referred
Asking authority to raise a Company for train or R. R. duty or any other - subject to the Governors order; but does not want to be attached to a Regt. Refers to divers gentlemen of Lebanon Ky.

ansd pag 83 Ltr Bk B
R. I G O. Septr 16- 1864
